title: About Me
text: Hi, friend. I’m Eric. If you’re interested in learning more about me, you can check out my personal site, where I occassionally blog and post stuff. You can also find me on Github

title: leakybrain
text: This is a site I created to drop random snippets of code and take notes related to programming, statistics, and other related topics. It was inspired by Vicki Boykis’s BoringML project.

title: Maximum Likelihood Estimation - Linear Regression
text:
using Distributions
using Random
using Optim
using GLM

Generate some fake data

Random.seed!(0408)

#x data
𝐗 = hcat(ones(1000), randn(1000, 3))

#ground truth betas
𝚩 = [.5, 1, 2, 3]

#multiply data by betas
f₁(X) = X*𝚩

#make some error
ϵ = rand(Normal(0, .5), size(𝐗)[1])

#generate y
y = f₁(𝐗) + ϵ;

Define a function to optimize

function mle_lm(x, y, params)
    b = params[begin:end-1]
    σ = params[end]

    ŷ = x*b

    residuals = y .- ŷ

    ll = -loglikelihood(Normal(0, σ), residuals)

    return ll
end

mle_lm (generic function with 1 method)


Run the optimization

start_params = [0.2, .5, 1, 1, 1]

res = optimize(params -> mle_lm(𝐗, y, params), start_params)

Optim.minimizer(res)

5-element Vector{Float64}:
 0.5220526008168841
 0.9925044101015756
 1.9951661029827337
 2.9979617225853903
 0.5170359122024899


Check against ‘base’ Julia solution

𝐗 \ y

4-element Vector{Float64}:
 0.5220524130050495
 0.9925035386795747
 1.9951668631756507
 2.9979619869409357
